content.description:
An awesome sandbagged climb sit starting on a sloper hueco for the left hand and a good right hand sidepull on the arête. Pull on with a good left foot and move up to a good sloper left of the arête with the left hand. Get your right foot on and move the right hand to a decent sidepull crimp. From here bring the left hand to good edges on the arête and work your way up and slightly right, utilizing the slopey crimp sidepulls for your right hand. Hard compression moves and a committing move to a sharp but good hold get you to the top of this guy. Top out on good holds.

Incredible movement and very aesthetically pleasing, but much harder than it looks. Possibly better than it's neighbor "All Fired Up".
content.protection: 2 pads and a spotter for the top.
content.location: The arête left of "All Fired Up". From "Cayla" walk about 15 yards towards The Thunderwall, and this boulder is on the left.

content.description:
A beautiful sweeping overhanging arete on good patina.

Climb the striking, near-perfect arete!
content.location: Past the 'Thunder Wall' a short distance on the right.  'All Fired Up' will be facing you (northwest arete, can't miss it).
